poem:
Rental Reveries  

One bed, two souls, wedged into the city's  
pulse—where pounds weigh heavier than dreams.  
They pawn space for a night's sleep,  
cling to each other's breath for warmth.  

Here, landlords reap what tenants sow,  
but love, despite its quarters,  
still finds room to grow.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. Have you decided to rent a room as a couple to save money? Perhaps you have downsized your home to cut costs?". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
